alert.note: Alert for Hutchinson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 10:26PM CDT until May 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South central and southeastern Hutchinson County and northeastern Carson County. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Borger and Skellytown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
